workflows_used: View or update personal profile / contact information, Search and register for courses, View grades or exam results, Find a student’s transcript and export it (PDF/CSV), Enrol / Unenrol a student in a course, Generate a student payment or status report, Submit or approve course grades, Manage tuition payments or invoices (administrators), Prepare academic reports or statistics, Generate references and export them
friction_points: Confusing terminology or unclear field names, Important actions are hidden / too small / far away, Access or permission issues block me, Some functionality is missing.
stuck_point: When exporting reports on student grades, it is unclear how the (W)GPA is calculated, so I usually export grades and calculate the (W)GPAs myself.
key_fix: There is no one change that would magically solve the issue, but the guiding principles should be consistency, simplicity, and clarity.
priority_workflows: Manage tuition payments or invoices (administrators), Prepare academic reports or statistics
comments: I feel like this survey would not be able to reflect the scale of the problem. LAIS in general is inconsistent, inconvenient, and confusing. For instance, sometimes it suddenly doesn't even let people log in with the same credentials that were fine the day before, and the (W)GPA that students see in their transcript differs from what they see in the Grades section.
open_text_all: Confusing terminology or unclear field names, Important actions are hidden / too small / far away, Access or permission issues block me, Some functionality is missing. When exporting reports on student grades, it is unclear how the (W)GPA is calculated, so I usually export grades and calculate the (W)GPAs myself. I feel like this survey would not be able to reflect the scale of the problem. LAIS in general is inconsistent, inconvenient, and confusing. For instance, sometimes it suddenly doesn't even let people log in with the same credentials that were fine the day before, and the (W)GPA that students see in their transcript differs from what they see in the Grades section. There is no one change that would magically solve the issue, but the guiding principles should be consistency, simplicity, and clarity.
